intro: Secamone glaberrima, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by distinctive, elongated fruits. Its roots and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for various ailments. The botanical features of Secamone glaberrima make it an important species in both ecological and pharmacological contexts.
